intro: Hieracium fulvocaesium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, basal leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has a creeping growth habit. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas, where it spreads through rhizomes and seeds.
